definition: painted eggshell/Easter egg/(media) Easter egg (hidden feature in software or a movie etc)/post-credits scene
egg rolling (rolling of decorated, hard-boiled eggs down hillsides by children at Easter)

sentences.english: On Easter Sunday morning, children hunt for the eggs and candy.
sentences.chinese: 在复活节的早上，孩子们就可以寻找彩蛋和糖果。

sentences.english: Many families color eggs and go to church for Easter in America.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，许多家庭在复活节时画彩蛋并上教堂。

sentences.english: The most elaborate eggs are decorated by the people from Poland and Ukraine.
sentences.chinese: 最精心制作彩蛋的是波兰人和乌克兰人。

sentences.english: Thus began the custom of writing on Easter eggs.
sentences.chinese: 于是就开始了在复活节彩蛋上写字的习俗。

sentences.english: Don't believe the Easter you look, he is quasi and can descend colourful egg of the proptosis band color.
sentences.chinese: 不信到复活节你看，他准能下出带色的彩蛋。

sentences.english: Sue and Tim are on an Easter egg hunt.
sentences.chinese: 苏和提姆在寻找复活节彩蛋。

sentences.english: Sometimes prizes of candy are awaiting the child finding the most eggs.
sentences.chinese: 哪个孩子找到的彩蛋最多，就有可能得到糖果奖励。

sentences.english: The origin of the "Easter egg"custom is not fully known.
sentences.chinese: 说到送复活节彩蛋习俗的起源，人们却不甚了解。

sentences.english: Why do people choose eggs and rabbits to celebrate that festival?
sentences.chinese: 为什么人们选择用彩蛋和兔子来庆祝这个节日呢？

sentences.english: In HD, if you can, so you can catch the Easter eggs.
sentences.chinese: 高清晰度的，你甚至可以找到复活节彩蛋。

definition: end credits (of a movie etc)/ending (of a movie etc)
sentence-final particle that conveys informality, warmth, friendliness or intimacy/may also indicate that one is stating a fact that the other person is not aware of
oh (interjection indicating that one has just learned sth)
to try to answer a question (in a quiz, guessing game, riddle etc)/quiz game
news from behind the scenes/stage gossip
opening titles (of movie)/leader (blank film at the beginning and end of a reel)
sentence-final particle, contraction of 了啊, indicating exclamation/particle placed after each item in a list of examples
(onom.) sound of singing, cheering etc/(phonetic)/(dialect) to chat
branch/stem/stalk/CL:根[gen1]/to block/to hinder/(Tw) interesting, fresh, or amusing subject matter or scenario
